citation.article-title: Salinarimonas ramus sp. nov. and Tessaracoccus oleiagri sp. nov., isolated from a crude oil-contaminated saline soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Tessaracoccus oleiagri sp. nov.
Tessaracoccus oleiagri (o.le.i.ag′ri. L. n. oleum -i oil; L. n. ager -gri productive land, a field; N.L. gen. n. oleiagri of an oilfield, the place where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-positive staining, facultatively anaerobic, non-endospore-forming, acid-fast, oval to rod-shaped (0.48×0.5–1.0 µm) without flagella.
Colonies are smooth, circular convex and bright yellow on ASW agar at 30 °C for 7 days.
Good growth occurs on Luria–Bertani medium and tryptic soy agar.
The optimum growth conditions are pH 7.0, 28 °C and 4 % (w/v) NaCl.
Positive for nitrate reduction, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, esterase (C4), leucine arylamidase and α-glucosidase.

Negative for β-galactosidase, lipase (C14), α-fucosidase, arginine dihydrolase, gelatinase, H2S production, hydrolysis of cellulose and for the assimilation of d-arabinose, d-mannose, N-acetyl-β-glucosamine, maltose, caprate, adipate, malate and phenylacetate.

Utilizes sodium citrate, xylose, d-ribose, rhamnose, raffinose, dulcitol, α-lactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, salicin, inulin, succinate, benzoate, d-mannitol, formate, sorbitol, d-galactose, trehalose and inositol, but not l-arabinose as sole carbon source.
Does not utilize alanine, l-proline, glycine, histidine, tryptophan, l-aspartate, phenylalanine or arginine as sole nitrogen source.
Resistant to gentamicin (10 µg), polymyxin B (300 IU) and neomycin (30 µg).

Sensitive to streptomycin (300 µg), ceftazidime (30 µg), amoxicillin (10 µg), rifampicin (5 µg), midecamycin (15 µg), tetracycline (30 µg), ciprofloxacin (5 µg), erythromycin (15 µg), vancomycin (30 µg), penicillin G (10 IU), novobiocin (5 µg), kanamycin (30 µg), chloramphenicol (30 µg), cefotaxime (30 µg) and sulfamethoxazole (300 µg).
Other physiological and biochemical properties are given in Table 2.
ll-DAP is the diagnostic diamino acid in cell wall.
The sugars in whole-cell hydrolysates of the three isolates are rhamnose, ribose, mannose, glucose and galactose.
MK-9 (H4) is the only menaquinone.
The major cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 and anteiso-C13 : 0.
The major polar lipids are DPG, PG, PIM, PI and PL.
The type strain, SL014B-20A1T ( = DSM 22955T = CGMCC 1.9159T), was isolated from a crude oil-polluted saline soil from Shengli Oilfield, eastern China.
Strains SL014B-76A1 and SL014B-79A are additional strains.
The G+C contents of the genomic DNA of all three strains are 65.65–67.17 mol%.
